arguments.description: Comma-separated fields to exclude from the response, using dot notation for sub-objects.

arguments.description: Specifies how many records to return, from 10 to 1000.

arguments.name: pagination_cursor
arguments.description: Paginate through records using a `next_cursor` from a previous request. By default, fetches the first page.

arguments.description: Restricts the response to contacts created at or before the specified time. Use ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+00:00.

arguments.name: created_since
arguments.description: Restrict contacts to those created after this timestamp (exclusive). Use ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+00:00.

arguments.name: restrict_by_update_date_before
arguments.description: Restricts the response to contacts updated at or before the specified date and time, using ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+00:00.

arguments.name: updated_since
arguments.description: Restrict response to contacts updated after this time using ISO 8601 format (exclusive).

api_endpoints.name: createAudienceContact

wrapper_tool.name: create_audience_contact

description.tagline: Create a new omni-channel contact for an audience.
description.detailed: Use this tool to add a new contact to a Mailchimp audience for omni-channel marketing.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of the newly created audience contact.

arguments.name: audience_unique_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the audience in Mailchimp where the contact will be added. This ID is necessary to specify the target audience for the new contact.

arguments.name: contact_details_json
arguments.description: JSON object containing contact details such as language, email, SMS info, merge fields, and tags for the new audience member.

arguments.name: merge_field_validation_mode
arguments.description: Choose 'ignore_required_checks' to skip validation on required merge fields, or 'strict' to enforce validation. Defaults to 'strict' if not set.

arguments.name: data_processing_mode
arguments.description: Selects the data processing mode: 'historical' mode skips automations and webhooks, 'live' mode triggers them.

api_endpoints.description: Create a new omni-channel contact for an audience.

query.name: merge_field_validation_mode

value_schema.description: Defines how merge field validation is handled. When set to `ignore_required_checks`, the API does not raise an error if required merge fields are missing from the request. When set to `strict`, the API enforces validation and returns an error if any required merge field is not provided. If this setting is omitted, `strict` is applied by default.

query.description: Defines how merge field validation is handled. When set to `ignore_required_checks`, the API does not raise an error if required merge fields are missing from the request. When set to `strict`, the API enforces validation and returns an error if any required merge field is not provided. If this setting is omitted, `strict` is applied by default.

query.name: data_mode

value_schema.description: Indicates the data processing mode. In `historical` mode, contact data changes do not trigger automations or webhooks. In `live mode`, such changes do trigger them.

query.description: Indicates the data processing mode. In `historical` mode, contact data changes do not trigger automations or webhooks. In `live mode`, such changes do trigger them.

wrapper_tool.name: create_mailchimp_campaign

description.tagline: Create a new Mailchimp campaign quickly.
description.detailed: This tool is used to initiate a new email campaign via Mailchimp. It should be called when a user wants to create and configure a marketing email or advertisement using Mailchimp's services.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Information about the newly created Mailchimp campaign.

arguments.name: campaign_details
arguments.description: JSON object detailing the campaign type, recipients, settings, tracking options, and more.

api_endpoints.description: Create a new Mailchimp campaign.

type.description: There are four types of [campaigns](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-campaigns/) you can create in Mailchimp. A/B Split campaigns have been deprecated and variate campaigns should be used instead.

saved_segment_id.description: The id for an existing saved segment.

conditions.description: Segment match conditions. There are multiple possible types, see the [condition types documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/alternative-schemas/#segment-condition-schemas).

segment_opts.description: An object representing all segmentation options. This object should contain a `saved_segment_id` to use an existing segment, or you can create a new segment by including both `match` and `conditions` options.

subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

title.description: The title of the campaign.

from_name.description: The 'from' name on the campaign (not an email address).

reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign. Note: while this field is not required for campaign creation, it is required for sending.

use_conversation.description: Use Mailchimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.description: The campaign's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name [audience field](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-merge-tags/).

folder_id.description: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the id for that folder.

authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp [authenticated](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-authentication/) the campaign. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.description: Automatically append Mailchimp's [default footer](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-campaign-footers/) to the campaign.

inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the [campaign archive](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-campaign-archives-and-pages/) page when the campaign is sent.

auto_fb_post.description: An array of [Facebook](https://mailchimp.com/help/connect-or-disconnect-the-facebook-integration/) page ids to auto-post to.

fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

template_id.description: The id of the template to use.

settings.description: The settings for your campaign, including subject, from name, reply-to address, and more.

winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenue -- or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the Mailchimp web application.

wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.

subject_lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.

send_times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.

from_names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.

reply_to_addresses.description: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.

variate_settings.description: The settings specific to A/B test campaigns.

opens.description: Whether to [track opens](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-open-tracking/). Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](https://mailchimp.com/help/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](https://mailchimp.com/help/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.
Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

tracking.description: The tracking options for a campaign.

feed_url.description: The URL for the RSS feed.

frequency.description: The frequency of the RSS Campaign.

hour.description: The hour to send the campaign in local time. Acceptable hours are 0-23. For example, '4' would be 4am in [your account's default time zone](https://mailchimp.com/help/set-account-defaults/).

sunday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Sundays.

monday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Mondays.

tuesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Tuesdays.

wednesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Wednesdays.

thursday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Thursdays.

friday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Fridays.

saturday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Saturdays.

daily_send.description: The days of the week to send a daily RSS Campaign.

weekly_send_day.description: The day of the week to send a weekly RSS Campaign.

monthly_send_date.description: The day of the month to send a monthly RSS Campaign. Acceptable days are 0-31, where '0' is always the last day of a month. Months with fewer than the selected number of days will not have an RSS campaign sent out that day. For example, RSS Campaigns set to send on the 30th will not go out in February.

schedule.description: The schedule for sending the RSS Campaign.

constrain_rss_img.description: Whether to add CSS to images in the RSS feed to constrain their width in campaigns.

rss_opts.description: [RSS](https://mailchimp.com/help/share-your-blog-posts-with-mailchimp/) options, specific to an RSS campaign.

image_url.description: The url for the header image for the card.

description.description: A short summary of the campaign to display.

title.description: The title for the card. Typically the subject line of the campaign.

social_card.description: The preview for the campaign, rendered by social networks like Facebook and Twitter. [Learn more](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-customize-social-cards/).

content_type.description: How the campaign's content is put together. The old drag and drop editor uses 'template' while the new editor uses 'multichannel'. Defaults to template.

fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The id of the template to use.

variate_settings.title: A/B Test Options
variate_settings.description: The settings specific to A/B test campaigns.

winner_criteria.title: Winning Criteria
winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenue -- or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the Mailchimp web application.

wait_time.title: Wait Time
wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

test_size.title: Test Size
test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.

subject_lines.title: Subject Lines
subject_lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.

send_times.title: Send Times
send_times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.

from_names.title: From Names
from_names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.

reply_to_addresses.title: Reply To Addresses
reply_to_addresses.description: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.

tracking.title: Campaign Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for a campaign.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-open-tracking/). Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](https://mailchimp.com/help/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](https://mailchimp.com/help/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

campaign.title: Salesforce Campaign
campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

notes.title: Salesforce Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

notes.title: Capsule Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

feed_url.title: Feed URL
feed_url.description: The URL for the RSS feed.

frequency.title: Frequency
frequency.description: The frequency of the RSS Campaign.

schedule.title: Sending Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for sending the RSS Campaign.

hour.title: Sending Hour
hour.description: The hour to send the campaign in local time. Acceptable hours are 0-23. For example, '4' would be 4am in [your account's default time zone](https://mailchimp.com/help/set-account-defaults/).

daily_send.title: Daily Sending Days
daily_send.description: The days of the week to send a daily RSS Campaign.

sunday.title: Sunday
sunday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Sundays.

monday.title: Monday
monday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Mondays.

tuesday.title: tuesday
tuesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Tuesdays.

wednesday.title: Monday
wednesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Wednesdays.

thursday.title: Thursday
thursday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Thursdays.

friday.title: Friday
friday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Fridays.

saturday.title: Saturday
saturday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Saturdays.

weekly_send_day.title: Weekly Sending Day
weekly_send_day.description: The day of the week to send a weekly RSS Campaign.

monthly_send_date.title: Monthly Sending Day
monthly_send_date.description: The day of the month to send a monthly RSS Campaign. Acceptable days are 0-31, where '0' is always the last day of a month. Months with fewer than the selected number of days will not have an RSS campaign sent out that day. For example, RSS Campaigns set to send on the 30th will not go out in February.

constrain_rss_img.title: Constrain RSS Images
constrain_rss_img.description: Whether to add CSS to images in the RSS feed to constrain their width in campaigns.

social_card.title: Campaign Social Card
social_card.description: The preview for the campaign, rendered by social networks like Facebook and Twitter. [Learn more](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-customize-social-cards/).

image_url.title: Image URL
image_url.description: The url for the header image for the card.

description.title: Campaign Description
description.description: A short summary of the campaign to display.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the card. Typically the subject line of the campaign.

Campaigns scheduled with Timewarp are localized based on the recipients' time zones. For example, a Timewarp campaign with a `schedule_time` of 13:00 will be sent to each recipient at 1:00pm in their local time. Cannot be set to `true` for campaigns using [Batch Delivery](https://mailchimp.com/help/schedule-batch-delivery/).

wrapper_tool.name: get_mailchimp_list_members

description.tagline: Retrieve member details from a specific Mailchimp list.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get information about members within a specified Mailchimp list. It's useful for accessing subscriber details such as email addresses and subscription status.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Information about members in a Mailchimp list.

arguments.name: list_unique_id
arguments.description: The unique ID for the Mailchimp list to retrieve member information from.

arguments.name: fields_to_return
arguments.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Use dot notation for sub-object parameters.

arguments.name: fields_to_exclude
arguments.description: Comma-separated list of fields to exclude from the response, using dot notation for sub-objects.

arguments.name: number_of_records_to_return
arguments.description: Specify the number of records to return, between 10 and 1000, default is 10.

arguments.name: pagination_offset
arguments.description: The number of records to skip for pagination. Default is 0.

arguments.name: email_type
arguments.description: Specify the type of email format. Typically 'html' or 'text'.

arguments.name: subscriber_status
arguments.description: The status of the subscriber (e.g., subscribed, unsubscribed, cleaned, pending).

arguments.name: opt_in_after_timestamp
arguments.description: Restrict results to subscribers who opted-in after the specified timeframe in ISO 8601 format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

arguments.name: opt_in_before_timestamp
arguments.description: Restrict results to subscribers who opted in before the specified timeframe. Use ISO 8601 format.

arguments.name: changed_after_timestamp
arguments.description: Restrict results to subscribers whose information changed after the specified timestamp in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00).

arguments.name: restrict_change_before_timeframe
arguments.description: Restrict results to subscribers whose information changed before the provided timeframe in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00').

arguments.name: unique_email_identifier
arguments.description: A unique identifier for the email address across all Mailchimp lists. Use this to filter for a specific member.

arguments.name: filter_vip_members
arguments.description: Filter to return only VIP list members. Use `true` for VIPs only, `false` for all members.

arguments.name: interest_category_id
arguments.description: The unique id for the interest category used to filter Mailchimp list members.

arguments.name: filter_by_interest_ids
arguments.description: Comma-separated list of interest IDs to filter list members. Must be combined with interest_category_id and interest_match.

arguments.name: interest_match_filter
arguments.description: Specify how to match list members by interests. Options: 'any', 'all', or 'none'. Must accompany interest_category_id and interest_ids.

arguments.name: sort_field_for_members
arguments.description: Specifies the field by which to sort the list members.

arguments.name: sort_order_direction
arguments.description: Determines the order direction for sorted results. Common values are 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

arguments.name: filter_by_since_last_campaign
arguments.description: Filter subscribers by their status (subscribed/unsubscribed/pending/cleaned) since the last email campaign. Requires member status.

arguments.name: filter_unsubscribed_since
arguments.description: Filter subscribers who unsubscribed since a specific date. Must use 'unsubscribed' status only.

api_endpoints.description: Get information about members in a specific Mailchimp list.

wrapper_tool.name: add_store_promo_rule

description.tagline: Add a new promo rule to an e-commerce store on Mailchimp.
description.detailed: This tool is used to add a new promotional rule to a specific e-commerce store within Mailchimp. It is ideal for automating the management of store promotions.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of the newly added promo rule.

arguments.name: store_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the store where the promo rule will be added.

arguments.name: promo_rule_details
arguments.description: JSON object containing details of the promo rule, including 'id', 'title', 'description', 'starts_at', 'ends_at', 'amount', 'type', 'target', 'enabled', 'created_at_foreign', and 'updated_at_foreign'. These fields ensure the creation or updating of the promotional rule adheres to specifications, such as format, length, and allowed values.

api_endpoints.description: Add a new promo rule to a store.

path.name: store_id

value_schema.description: The store id.

path.description: The store id.

id.description: A unique identifier for the promo rule. If Ecommerce platform does not support promo rule, use promo code id as promo rule id. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 50.

title.description: The title that will show up in promotion campaign. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length of 100 bytes.

description.description: The description of a promotion restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 255.

starts_at.description: The date and time when the promotion is in effect in ISO 8601 format.

ends_at.description: The date and time when the promotion ends. Must be after starts_at and in ISO 8601 format.

amount.description: The amount of the promo code discount. If 'type' is 'fixed', the amount is treated as a monetary value. If 'type' is 'percentage', amount must be a decimal value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed.

target.description: The target that the discount applies to.

enabled.description: Whether the promo rule is currently enabled.

created_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was updated in ISO 8601 format.

json_schema.title: E-commerce Promo Rule
json_schema.description: Information about an Ecommerce Store's specific Promo Rule.

id.title: Promo Rule Foreign ID

title.description: The title that will show up in promotion campaign. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length of 100 bytes.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of a promotion restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 255.
description.example: Save BIG during our summer sale!

starts_at.title: Promo Start Time
starts_at.description: The date and time when the promotion is in effect in ISO 8601 format.

ends_at.title: End Time
ends_at.description: The date and time when the promotion ends. Must be after starts_at and in ISO 8601 format.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The amount of the promo code discount. If 'type' is 'fixed', the amount is treated as a monetary value. If 'type' is 'percentage', amount must be a decimal value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed.

target.title: Target
target.description: The target that the discount applies to.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of the order added to the store.

arguments.name: store_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the store where the order will be added. This should be a string value that accurately corresponds to an existing store in the system.

arguments.description: A JSON object containing order details such as customer info, order total, currency, line items, shipping/billing addresses, and more. Required to add a new order.

This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing Mailchimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your Mailchimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/e-commerce/#customers).

wrapper_tool.name: update_ecommerce_order

description.tagline: Add or update an order in an ecommerce store.
description.detailed: Use this tool to either add a new order or update an existing order within an ecommerce store in Mailchimp Marketing. This tool is suitable when order details need to be adjusted or fresh orders are being added.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirms the addition or update of an order in an ecommerce store.

arguments.name: store_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the store in which the order is being added or updated.

arguments.name: order_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the order in the store. Used to specify which order to update or add.

arguments.name: order_request_data
arguments.description: The JSON object containing all order details such as customer info, financial status, and line items.
